item.title: Custom JWT Claims with Ory Kratos
item.description: JSON Web Tokens (JWT) are data structures that allow the holder of the token to assert claims that are able to be cryptographically verified. An example would be that a claim could hold a user claim role like administrator that if proven to be unaltered (using a shared public key) then could be used to provide access to certain administrator functions. Tools like PostgREST, Hasura and Supabase (a managed PostgREST) rely on JWTs to carry a user’s claims where the role claim is used to set a Postgres role to enforce role-based access control.
